feed.title: Nagoya University, Graduate School of Law (en/Events)
feed.rights: Copyright 2014 Faculty of Law, Nagoya University

div.p: We are pleased to announce a presentation by Associate Professor Bennett of GSL:

This will be an informal workshop in two segments. Problems and style debugging issues will have priority, so if you are having difficulties, bring them to the session. Other topics covered will be determined by the interest of participants. If you have specific problems you would like to discuss, please bring along your PC so we can examine the issues directly.
The session is open to the public.

entry.title: Akiyoshi Yonezawa: International Human Resource Development at Nagoya University

div.p: We are pleased to announce a presentation by Associate Professor Akiyoshi Yonezawa of GSID:

blockquote.p: International Human Resource Development at Nagoya University.

div.p: Professor Yonezawa is active both domestically and overseas in the study of internationalisation and curriculum management in Japanese higher education.

Amid the hue and cry over University internationalisation and global human resource development, this will be an opportunity, in our specific context, to reflect on practice, and on the significance and desirability of recent developments. Ample time will be reserved for discussion following Professor Yonezawa's presentation.

Instructors for University-wide course offerings in both Spring and Fall terms are encouraged to attend this event. (As previously noted to instructors, Faculty Development sessions are held just once in each year.)
This session is open to instructors only. The proceedings will be conducted in Japanese.
A farewell party for students who have completed their studies will be held on Tuesday, 25 March.
Staff and junior classmates are welcome to come help us celebrate this new beginning for our graduating class.
